website_summaries.verdict: Fast aperture prime lens that creates amazing photos with a medium telephoto focal length.
pros: Extremely sharp photos with precise focusing mechanism
Medium telephoto prime focal length lens of 85 millimeters is not common but is highly useful
Small lens size balances well when attached to camera
cons: No telephoto capability limits the types of photos you can shoot

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portrait lens!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses by far. Perfect for portraits and getting amazing bokeh. Lens is fast and great in low light. Definitely a must have for my D750.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Grand Slam
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more pleased with this glass. All my lenses are Nikkor: albeit most are AF-D types. Using primarily on a D7100. Highly recommended for the more experienced photographer who can obtain outstanding results on their carry-all cameras. Also, perfect for the beginner looking for great sharpness right from the start of their photographic journeys. No lens tuning required on mine whatsoever. Colors are rendered perfectly. Great purchase for the budget minded as well. Thanks Nikon, your reputation glows with this guy.
customer_reviews.author: KentuckyRifle

customer_reviews.title: Be weary, "replay tech" seller doesn't check the functionality of the lens prior to shipping.
customer_reviews.text: A defective lens came in. It makes this horrendous high pitched noise when the lens is trying to focus. Turns out it's a symptom of impending AF-S/gear failure.
customer_reviews.author: Hyun Jae Lim

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down my favorite lens for portraits
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite lens for portraits. It gives such a beautiful background blur. I have the 35 and 50 as well but this is always the one I am excited to use because of the blur. I just wish I could get more opportunities to use it; its only drawback is that it's so zoomed in that it can't really be used in indoor settings or tight spaces. You need lots of room to be able to back up to get everything you want in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Kayci

customer_reviews.title: 95% of the features of the 85mm f/1.4 for a third of the price
customer_reviews.text: A fast, sharp, light, affordable portrait lens for a fraction of the price (and weight) of the f/1.4. If you are an enthusiast who cannot justify a ~$1500 price tag, or a professional looking to travel light, you should give this lens a serious consideration. It's even sharper than the 1.4, and the bokeh is almost as good with simple precautions like making sure to not have something too high-contrast out of focus.
customer_reviews.author: rajp

customer_reviews.title: Almost
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this lens 10/10 however it has a distortion that shows up in every image which basically makes this a dud for me. I shouldn't have to edit out distortions on every photo with lightroom or luminar or photoshop. Very annoying. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: DX format d3400
customer_reviews.text: Very nice image quality. The thing i noticed right away was a bit more chromatic aberration than normally so be extra mindful of that in post process. Other than that great portrait lens. Bought mine used - like new in MINT condition for some 350 bucks. Quality-to-price ratio is through the ceiling.. Something I'd expect from 1200+ lens. This one is also a great budget alternative to the 85mm f1.4.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens! For the price I don’t think the quality and image can be beat. I bought this for my wife so we could take better photos of our kids. This lens has been great. Picture is sharp in almost any lighting. The only slight downside I have found is the auto focus can be a tad slow. Manual focus or manual override is great in these situations. Wonderful lense!
customer_reviews.author: L. Seebeck

customer_reviews.title: Must have Nikon FF lens.
customer_reviews.text: IMO this lens is a must have if you have a Nikon FF camera. This lens is sharp wide open in the center and has excellent contrast. I also have the D version of this lens. The D version will is more prone to flaring especially with a backlit subject. In comparing the 2 I prefer the Bokeh and smooth transition of the G version but the D version is no slouch either. The microcontrast seems to be better on the G series lens when shooting high key shots at the same aperture. I like both lenses because sometimes I want natural flare in my shots but when I don't I slap on the G series.
customer_reviews.author: HazelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality with a nice bokeh.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the 1.4 is a grand more, this is a great lens for the price. Light weight and fast. I know some people would rather have the 1.4, but I could not justify spending the extra money for a 2/3 stop more, especially considering the ISO quality of most cameras now. This lens is quickly become my favorite over my nifty 50.
customer_reviews.author: C.S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: what a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens with my Nikon D600 and its a killer combination for portrait photography. Prior to this I used a Sony A580/A77 with a sony 50mm F1.8 SAM DT lens. I was pretty comfortable using 75mm equivalent focal length 95% of the time, but i find this 85mm a bit tricky to use as a general walk around lens or indoors. for people photography its boss though,. super creamy bokeh, sharp sharp sharp, and colors! I do most of my portraits at F2.8 and even then depth of field can be a bit to shallow from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: David TiffanyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill of an 85mm f/1.8
customer_reviews.text: You'll get this because you either want an 85 that is cheaper than a 1.4 or smaller and lighter than a 1.4 And it fits the both while being a great lens. Nikon's FX f1.8 primes are a bit plastic-y, but I love how light weight they are for travel. They also help turn some beastly cameras into better "street photo" camera's with a smaller silhouette.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Winters

customer_reviews.title: Very nice portrait lens.
customer_reviews.text: I have been comparing this lens to the f1.4 version Nikon has. This is what led me to buy this one. 85mm f1.4 : 9 aperture blades, nano coated, 77mm filter thread, and cost about $1700 85mm f1.8: 7 aperture blades, no nano, 67mm filter thread, and cost about $500. After reading some articles on the internet... the one that made the decision for me was where they were both tested for sharpness on the D800e. they were almost identical. I can still use my 77mm filters with a step-up ring, have not noticed and bad shaped bokeh.. so im very happy with my purchase. This lens make for an AMAZING portrait lens. I am using in on a D610.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Bargain lens for FX
customer_reviews.text: I have heavier, more expensive Nikon lenses but this 85mm f/1.8G is just right for air travel. With the recent Nikon discounts this lens is bargain priced lens yet produces sharp and contrasty images when used with my D800e. My intended use is mostly for street and landscape photography so - the aperture will be stopped down from f/4.5 to f/7.1 I recommend always leaving the lens hood on and using a B+W nano coated clear filter to protect the front element without degrading the image. Internal focus and lens mount gasket, great features.
customer_reviews.author: El polizonte

customer_reviews.title: My only regret...not buying sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: This lens creates exceptional bokeh! If you are OK with a longer focal length/being further away from your subjects this lens creates phenomenal results! Like all Nikon lenses this is of highest quality and creates such tac sharp images! I have used this lens a professional photographer for both individual and family photos with magnificent results. I really cannot say enough about this lens. My only regret is not buying sooner!
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Very Good But Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent lens but shows chromatic aberration wide open even at the image center. Mostly gone by F4. Extremely sharp at F8 even in the corners. When compared to a nikon 16-85 zoom at 85 mm and F8: this lens is slightly sharper in the center and much better in the corners (the zoom has a large amount of lateral chromatic aberration in the corners).
customer_reviews.author: Que Sera

customer_reviews.title: Nice would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've played with it a few times now and it's great! I'm still learning photography so I'm just figuring out alot of the the settings but it was super easy to learn the settings.
customer_reviews.author: sarah craner

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted the 85 mm 1.4, but after reading reviews, the 1.8 is still just as great and for $1000 cheaper!! It's not as crisp as the 1.4, but I still love it!! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens, get it instead of the 1.4
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, the focal length is great for portraits on my DX camera (would be fine on FX too, but 100+mm might be even better). After reading lots of positive reviews I got this even though I did consider the much more expensive f/1.4 85mm. I was mostly concerned about the build quality as I've read reviews claiming it feels like plastic. I don't find this to be the case - the lens is not heavy but definitely does not feel cheap in my hands. Paired with a normal-sized DSLR (I use it on my D7100), the result is a perfectly balanced, not too heavy but not flimsy feel. Love shooting with this and the results are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens but long on a DX
customer_reviews.text: This is a dreamy portrait lens that produces beautiful bokeh! On a DX camera, this lens produces stunning results for headshots. I only rated 2 stars for landscapes because it would not be very useful on DX. On a full-frame body, this would still be perfect for all types of portraits and decent (though somewhat long) for landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: ABGreene

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't love it more!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to use for portraits after reading the reviews. I LOVE it! I am in photography school currently, and am building my business. This lens provides a soft and gorgeous bokeh, perfect for outdoor portraits. I am a bit biased towards zoom lenses since I learned on those and this was actually my first fixed lens, but I couldn't be happier with this purchase. I will likely be purchasing the similar 35mm next after my great experiences with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome focal length
customer_reviews.text: Awesome focal length . I have always been a zoom user but as i have been able to afford more semi pro lenses I'm starting to see a difference in my photography. Primes are definitely less to think about and focus more on creativity rather than which focal length should i be using
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Baugh Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. So sharp, bokeh is extraordinary. Get it, you won't regret it. I shoot on a d7000 which is a cropped sensor, so it runs at about 110mm rather than 85mm, still works great, I stand about 6 foot from the subject it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens, very closed to the 1
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, very closed to the 1.4 but you can see a little more "busy" background bokeh, not as smooth as I had hoped. Sharp, but not razor sharp. Still a great lens, but for the price compared to the 1.4 it is fine and will surpass most users expectations. Attached is a handheld RAW image no adjustments at all. front and rear bokeh example. Sharpness suffered from wind and handheld a bit. Seems soft in the focus to me when I use it, but nothing most shooters won't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sierraimage

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses. Incredibly sharp
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses. Incredibly sharp, good handling and nice rendering. Crisper than the 1.8D and the images are ever so slightly different. Not necessarily sharper but the contrast is different.
customer_reviews.author: silverboi

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: This lens is now the best lens I have. For me that’s a big thing. F1.8 works great and the focus especially for Headshots or Portraits is phenomenal. I started out using my Nikon F1.8 50mm lens and it’s a good lens as well. Then I was using my Nikon F2.8 70-200mm and it was good as well. But this Nikon 85mm Is just great for Portraits and Headshots. Don’t debate just order .
customer_reviews.author: STYLISH 1

customer_reviews.title: Tack sharp
customer_reviews.text: Super quick auto focus and sharp as a tack. I bought this refurbished and I'm here to tell you it is brand new. I would have no reservations about buying a different lens the same way. To top it all off, it was delivered earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: What a lens!
customer_reviews.text: After reading many positive reviews I bought it. I’m glad I did. I got it mostly for portrait and street photography but have found it to be versatile for other image types too. I use it on my D7200 (crop sensor) so it becomes a 127 mm lens. It’s fast and sharp. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Optically Stunning!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bokeh, contrast, resolution, sharpness and image rendition. One of the best lenses that you can mount onto your D810 that Nikon has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: John Rain

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this lens. It takes fantastic pictures. Its crisp and clear. It is a beautiful portrait lens and is a must-have for your photography lens collection. In addition to portraits I find this great for close up shots of nature, details, etc. it has great speed and sharp focus. I have been blown away by my pictures.
customer_reviews.author: guardinanangel

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm a amateur photographer. My usual walk around lens is the 35mm but the 85mm is now by far my favorite. This is THE go to lens for portraits. Sharp quality and beautiful in low light. When I was reading reviews, and tossing up between this lens and some others, the word 'creamy' was often mentioned and now I see why. I am very happy I chose this lens and very pleased with the quality of portraits it has produced!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lee

customer_reviews.title: NOT a new lenses 🤬🤬
customer_reviews.text: Lens are amazing good but please don’t get it from here go direct to Nikon if you are planing to get this lens.. if you get it from here they will send you used lens or refurbished product.. pretty much don’t get it from here... 🤬🤬🤬
customer_reviews.author: Cimanci

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for the money, upgraded from a 50mm prime to using this and a 35mm prime, which is a much better setup. If you want to do portraits or wedding photos this is then lens for you.
customer_reviews.author: NTred

customer_reviews.title: Every shot is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to the 85mm f/1.4 and $1000 less. Nice blurred backgrounds and low light capability. May not work for small studio because you need to be quite far back from the subject.
customer_reviews.author: flyinhawaiian84

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!
customer_reviews.text: The sharpness this lens has is fantastic. Portraits look flawless with this lens. If you are looking for zero distortion from "wide" angle lenses this is it. People won't be stretched and pulled creating the "camera adds 10 lb look." If you want an 85mm this is it. The sigma art lens will be sharper but comes at much more considerable cost. The rubber ring feels a bit cheap though. There doesn't seem to be any metal parts except the connector to the camera body. The glass is very nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this lens! I would have liked to try the 1.4 but I didn’t feel like the $1100 difference was worth it! Maybe it is... but I wouldn’t recover that cost for what I’m using it for. Photos are SOOC from Nikon D850.
customer_reviews.author: Phanessa

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two upcoming weddings and with the 1.8 aperture it will be great inside the venues. The filter size is 67mm and already have two filters that size for my Nikon 18-300mm lens and also have the Nikon 35mm lens, so this 85mm lens will round out my collection nicely
customer_reviews.author: Willow Grace Images

customer_reviews.title: Great for a used item!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used and was more than happy. It was a little dusty and had some dirt in the crevices, but nothing terrible. I LOVE this lens! A huge upgrade from my 35 mm. I use this as my prime lens now.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for wedding and portrait photographers
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens for portraits and I love it. It definitely excels when used on a full frame body (I have a D610), but still is amazing on a DX body too (husband uses a D7100). I don’t go anywhere without it. Worth the money and a staple lens for portrait/wedding photographers!
customer_reviews.author: J&H B.

customer_reviews.title: Great glass!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been talking about this glass off and on for a while and finally bought it. So far she is VERY pleased. This glass has created shap crisp images at various distances and lighting conditions with great focus speed. She is very pleased
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: value with excellent results
customer_reviews.text: I own the Nikon 85mm f/1.4G AF-S version of this lens and bought this as a gift for a relative. There is a difference in comparing the two in their rendering at more open apertures with my preference toward the f/1.4G. That said, the f/1.8G is wonderfully sharp across its range and once stopped down to apertures that you would use for landscapes, there is no perceivable difference between the two. Considering the vast difference in price between the two, one can only have love for this lens.
customer_reviews.author: wafer

customer_reviews.title: Best portrait lens I own
customer_reviews.text: Best portrait lens I own. I've shot many portrait sessions with this lens and get pro results. The DOF is excellent and the sharpness is terrific. There is some croma when there is a lot o contrast, but it's easily correctable if shooting RAW.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Price

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love! This is hands down my favorite lens for my portraits. This lens literally never leaves my camera unless I'm shooting in super tight spaces. It makes gorgeous pictures and creates such a creamy bokeh. I'm in love with this lens. Seriously worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Gossiaux

customer_reviews.title: Super lens, I know people always say that is ...
customer_reviews.text: Super lens, I know people always say that is great for portraits and is true, but I use it 90% for coverage my weddings all the time, not just portraits. For shootings is my horseback, beautiful boke, very sharp and always, always I shoot at 1.8
customer_reviews.author: esteban araujo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portrait lens, awesome bokeh, awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, was considering the 1.4 $1400 85mm but after watching reviews and trying this out for myself, I’m very happy I went with this one. Also super light compared to the 24-70mm i been shooting with. Nikon d750
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this is a great Nikon lens. Great for portraits. Great bokeh. Excellent clarity and resolution. not too expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of different 85mm, including 85mm 1.4 Canon, Nikon and Sigma. This is really stellar ! The Sigma 85mm is great, but the color of the Nikon are better, and it's so much lighter !
customer_reviews.author: Thierry Brouard

customer_reviews.title: Good for closeups
customer_reviews.text: This is my first prime lense and I absolutely love it. It is very good for close up portrait photos, it’s more difficult to get full body shots and you lose the sharpness when you do get them. Because I would love to be able to capture more of the scenery in my portraits and have more versatility I am planning to get the Sigma Art 35mm 1.4 lens to go with this one. I’ve attached photos from a recent photoshoot. I am using the Nikon D750 body
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Go for the Tamaron 85mm with ...
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Go for the Tamaron 85mm with image stabilization- it is miles ahead in sharpness as compared to this Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: AA2

customer_reviews.title: great lens, incredibly sharp
customer_reviews.text: great lens, incredibly sharp, focuses quicker than i expected after reading some reviews. i will be using this mostly with extension tubes as a macro instead of spending way way more than is necessary for a regular macro.
customer_reviews.author: eric w

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I'm very happy that I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I'm very happy that I bought it. Nice and sharp. I can't wait to go out and shoot with it more!
customer_reviews.author: JAGF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: The construction and low light capability of the lens is exceptional. Autofocus is fasrt and precise. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Adams

customer_reviews.title: having a great time with this awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: having a great time with this awesome lens. It has made my picture go from ordinary to extraordinary!! I need all the help I can get. I use it on my Nikon d750. This was the first lens I bought after my kit lens and think it is a good investment for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Photomama

customer_reviews.title: Quality improvement over original lens.
customer_reviews.text: Super prime lense for clear results. A major improvement over the original packaged lens purchased with my I use the FX on my DX Nikon D5300 with excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase for portrait photos
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great option for me to use for portrait photography. Love the ability to handle some low light situations as well. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Martin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Portrait Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is one helluva sharp portrait lens. It is fast and creates nice bokeh. I have shot some beautiful landscapes with this as well and they were sharp as ever. I would have loved to get my hands on the 1.4G which is very impressive compared to this cheap skate and I will do so at some stage as soon as I can pop off the 1.8G which I decided to buy because the price was unbeatable. For the moment this lens has not failed me in any shoots and I am pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Senhorpedro

customer_reviews.title: New to Photography
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to photography and ordered this lens based on reviews. I'm absolutely in love with this lens, it takes great portrait photos I'm a mom to a one year old and a six years old so most of my picture taking is of my kids. This lens blurs out background perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to purchase this lens after reading the reviews, and boy am I glad I did! Took my best photos I have ever taken with this lens. Great for family or self portraits. I think I will use this more than my 50mm.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality and portability
customer_reviews.text: This lens paired with my D750 delivered great image quality. It was also lighter than I was expecting an 85 mm 1.8 to be.
customer_reviews.author: J.L. GarciaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!!
customer_reviews.text: This lens was great, especially for portrait photography. I use this more than the 50mm f/1.8 G prime lens even though I can't be so close to the subject. Great in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Little Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Love my 85mm lens! Pair it with a flash and you've got yourself a killer portrait setup.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens. One of my faves. Best for portraits- not landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: RFH

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting this to be a game changer for portrait photography. sadly, it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out and the lens kept making everything/everyone wider that I went back to the 50mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: tksheikh

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite lens. I love the way the focal point ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens. I love the way the focal point is wonderfully sharp while seamlessly fading or "blurring" into the remainder of the photo. Naturally, the f/1.8 produces soft, dreamy looking portraits. It's fast, quiet, and high quality. I highly recommend for any serious photographer because your photos will look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens, I used to shoot with Nikon 85mm ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens, I used to shoot with Nikon 85mm 1.8D for many years and loved it, This newer G version lens is lighter and yes it's fouses a bit slower but the colors and sharpens beats the D version.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tony

customer_reviews.title: All you need for photography. Purchased this and an ...
customer_reviews.text: All you need for photography. Purchased this and an adapter for my olympus pen. saved about 500 dollars from buying an olympus lens.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Professional results/Amateur price
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a sharp portrait lens, this is for you. Not too expensive for the amateur and delivers professional results. Produces a sharp subject with a blurred background making every shot beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Luvmypug

customer_reviews.title: Good for indoor sports and crystal ball photos
customer_reviews.text: I’m still just learning photography and this lens helped me get good photos of my kids volleyball games. Since buying the men’s, ive invested a lot more time into learning how to use both it and my camera. This lens is also great for crystal ball photography.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Trivoli

customer_reviews.title: Best decision!
customer_reviews.text: Best decision I have made for my photography. I use this lens on my D7000 for business and it has made taking portraits and head shots a snap! They are tack sharp and has minimize my post editing immensely. My new favorite go to lens.
customer_reviews.author: Joie Cameron-Brown

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lens. I'm not all techy so I will leave that to the pros, but I bought this lens to help with my portrait photography and it is a dream. I would have rather had the 85mm 1.4G, but uh, I am not in a place to spend $1000 more than I already did. The bokeh is so pretty and instead of it looking blurry, like the 50mm or the 35mm, you can actually see what it is, but it's a creamy blur. If that makes any kind of sense at all. It is wonderful though!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Teller

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: love the focus works great. must have if you are a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens. I love Nikon's prime lenses
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I love Nikon's prime lenses. The 85mm allows me to have a little more distance between me and the person I am taking a portrait of.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Archer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This lens is exactly as described, the seller was also very quick to respond to my questions and packed the lens very very securely which I really appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: meredith brooke troutman

customer_reviews.title: SWEET!! Great work and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: O.M.G.!! I love this lens. So quiet and works very smooth. Photos just pop out at you if you do it right. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F

customer_reviews.title: A must have lens
customer_reviews.text: I have every other Nikon lens from 14-24 to 400mm lens, and was missing a 85 prime. I love using this lens for portraits and low light concert photography. I think I like the bokeh better on the 1.8G than I do on the 1.4G- I certainly like the price! This is a must have prime. I find that I use it more than my 105.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Tuck

customer_reviews.title: I wished I would have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to take my new lens out on a snowshoeing trip to RMNP a few days ago and my photos are absolutely stellar. I had only previously owned a kit lens (shooting with a Nikon D3300 at the moment), and this will definitely be my go-to lens from now on! Very sharp images. So glad I settled on this one and would hiiiighly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well in low light
customer_reviews.text: Got it for taking candid portraits of family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G. Harden Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My son in law is a great photographer. He was very pleased with this .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very bad purple fringing
customer_reviews.text: Nice and lite and small but has very bad purple fringing when shooting at 1.8 to F2. Using a Nikon D500. Nice and sharp images.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is absolutely wonderful for portrait photography. I am the grandmother of newborn twins. This was a very expensive lens but it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Best for portraits. Very sharp. It sometimes has trouble focusing.
customer_reviews.author: H. Goeller

customer_reviews.title: my favorite Lens ever
customer_reviews.text: absolutely the best lens I have. very sharp. nice boka. no complains
customer_reviews.author: Ali Reza Mazaheri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens and the quality I am seeing in my pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie R. Mc

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp. One of the highest rated lens for ...
customer_reviews.text: You absolutely cannot go wrong with this lens. Super sharp. One of the highest rated lens for sharpness that you can buy and for the price it's must have lens for any camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Silver-Submarine

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Its a little slow to focus, but it will nail the focus. Good lens overall.
customer_reviews.author: Thom H.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Shooting on a D800, this is great for candid and head shots. I personally prefer a 35mm for all around use. But 85mm has its place for portraits, and this one is a great mix of size/weight and price.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: Crazy sharp pictures
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these today. The shipping was superfast (Placed order at 12:30 A.M and it was at doorstep by 10:30 in the morning..same day). I have Nikon D5100 which I am replacing with Nikon D7100 soon. I also own the 50 mm 1.8 G and this lens was a natural upgrade for me. For the price, this lens produces some very sharp images. The color boundaries are very distinct and being a 1.8 G allows you to capture photos at low light levels. Overall, a very good purchase. A must have for enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv Varma

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous lens!
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens! I'm used to shooting with a 35mm so jumping to 85mm is so different (but fun!) Great quality. This is my third Nikon lens and I have had amazing success with them. Long lasting and beautiful images! I shoot with a Nikon D810.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s awesome for the price. Takes nice clean photos and the focus mechanism is good.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens. Takes great portraits. A standard lens to have for photo work.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens! Got this in favour of the 1.4, and i'm extremely happy I did. The 1.4 is good, but for 1/3 the price, this lens is stellar! Colour rendition, sharpness, just overall marvellous lens!
customer_reviews.author: Valdano Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is excellent for portrait photography. Very sharp and produces nice creamy bokeh. No back or front focusing. It fits great on both my DX and FX bodies. Couldn't be happier. I don't think paying more for faster version of this lens is justified expense.
customer_reviews.author: Baku

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens. Perfect for lower light and portraits
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. Perfect for lower light and portraits. My wife uses it for every photo session she does. Because of being 85mm, it requires you to be a bit further back than most shots. It makes a great unfocused background.
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeDadGear

customer_reviews.title: The 85mm 1.8G is just Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens in fact is my favorite lens Pros: - Sharp Images - Fast focusing - Soft creamy bokeh on the background - Fast - Extremely good for low light situations Cons: - Heavy The best portrait pictures i have take and the best results i've got is with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kajimaru

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 85mm f/1.8G AF-S Nikkor lens for SLR
customer_reviews.text: The lens is light but well-built. It is very sharp and gives rich color. The bokeh is great. Personally, I like the distance between the subject and the lens required by this lens. It is not too close, like the 50mm lens, nor is it too far, like the 105mm. It is a good companion to travel. And the price has been reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: David Jeng

customer_reviews.title: excellent packaging to avoid damage during transport
customer_reviews.text: It is a super- lens , excellent packaging to avoid damage during transport , branding guarantees an excellent product and try and use it in a D7100 works incredibly. recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sharp images - love it a lot! Use it for headshots.
customer_reviews.author: Keto Munchies

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Good lens with specific uses. Wildlife photos turned out really well. Glad to have it in my lens collection.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, but LOVE it. So glad I didn't spend $1000 more for the 1.4, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is great, and for this price you won't find a ...
customer_reviews.text: Ahhh, the bokeh with this lens. Build quality is great, and for this price you won't find a sharper focus or creamier bokeh! It almost never leaves my camera, as long as I am ample shooting room to work with. LOVE this lens.
customer_reviews.author: ashleysara

product_meta.title: Nikon AF S NIKKOR 85mm f/1.8G Fixed Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description: Style:Lens OnlyTo focus using autofocus with manual override (M/A): Slide the lens focus-mode switch to M/A. If desired, autofocus can be over-ridden by rotating the lens focus ring while the shutter-release button is pressed halfway (or, if the camera is equipped with an AF-ON button, while the AF-ON button is pressed). To refocus using autofocus, press the shutter-release button halfway or press the AF-ON button again. The fast maximum aperture of f/1.8 performs brilliantly under any lighting conditions and delivers beautiful, natural background blur that brings out the best in any subject. Compatible Format(s) - FX, DX, FX in DX Crop Mode, 35mm Film.
feature_bullets: Internal focus, focal length: 85 millimeter, minimum focus range: 0.80 meter
Silent wave motor (SWM). Number of diaphragm blades: 7 (rounded diaphragm opening)
M/a focus mode switch. Filter-attachment size is 67 millimeter (p=0.75 millimeter)
85 millimeter fixed lens, maximum reproduction ratio 0.12 x
